adjectives.description: exceptional (comparative more exceptional, superlative most exceptional)

entries.meaning: Forming an exception; not ordinary; uncommon; rare.
Better than the average; superior due to exception or rarity.
examples: The quality of the beer was exceptional.

entries.meaning: (geometry) Corresponding to something of lower dimension under a birational correspondence.
examples: an exceptional curve; an exceptional divisor

entries.meaning: An exception, or something having an exceptional value
examples: Above and beyond all these exceptionals, by reason of divergencies from the norms of mental and of physical status, there are quite a number of moral defectives.
